New Records: Ireland skipper Andy Balbirnie smashed a 47-ball 62 for his 8th T20I fifty
Key Match Events: Ireland defeated England by five runs via the Duckworth-Lewis method
Ireland collapsed in 19.2 overs from being 92 for 1 in 10 overs
Liam Livingstone and Mark Wood snared three wickets apiece to turn it around for England
Post-Match Reflections: Ireland continued their giant-killing act in the T20 World Cup and pulled off yet another upset win, defeating England by five runs via the Duckworth-Lewis method
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was also Ireland's maiden win in the second stage of the T20 World Cup
The Ireland win has now opened the doors for Australia as five of the six teams in the group now have two points each
Others: Left-arm pacer Josh Little swung the new ball both ways and dismissed the two English openers Jos Buttler (0) and Alex Hales (7) in space of nine balls
